alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 4:50PM CDT until May 15 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Lawrence and Stone. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Flat Creek at Highway C, Flat Creek at Highway Y, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Silver Lake Branch at Highway U and Tin Can Hollow at Highway CC. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aurora, Cassville, Marionville, Crane, Galena, Mccord Bend, Hurley, Wheelerville, Elsey, Jenkins, Madry, Mcdowell and Ponce de Leon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
